intro: Begonia capituliformis, commonly known as the clustered begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and vibrant green color. Its flowers, typically pink or red, bloom in spring and summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. Begonia capituliformis is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded outdoor gardens due to its preference for moist, well-drained soil.
